author: Sophie Dahl
method: Heat the olive oil in a saucepan, add the shallots and garlic and fry gently until softened but not coloured. Add the curry powder and fry for 3-4 minutes. Add the shallots and garlic to the cooked rice and stir in the flaked fish and cream. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.  To serve, spoon into a serving dish and scatter the quartered hard-boiled eggs and fresh coriander leaves over the top.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  4 shallots, chopped,  1 clove garlic, chopped,  1 tsp mild curry powder,  250g/8oz basmati or long grain rice, cooked and drained,  500g/1lb 2oz salmon or smoked haddock, cooked, skinned and flaked,  150ml/Â¼ pint double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  3 free-range eggs, hard-boiled, cut into quarters,  small handful fresh coriander, to garnish
